column4: NEED HELP: How can I tell Ubuntu to install to a drive the installer does not see, but Ubuntu livecd sees under gpart?
I read the 4th gen book like 10 years ago, was good then, I can only imagine the volume they have now
makes customizing kernels to your needs easy
Where can I find installing Ubuntu ADVANCED help?
just had to "hack" a device driver in order to get Ubuntu to see one of my SATA controllers, but still can't install to the drive that GPART can now see...
This more or less seems to be a kiddie channel
What file system is on the drive?
the drive wasn't anything, I just built a partition structer in hopes to get Ubuntu to see the drive
I did, 6GB linux-swap part, ext4 / partition, and ext4 /home partition
Sounds like a bug, sorry for the missunderstanding. I have been able to install it to any drive i like on multiple machines.
I can't see this drive, it took work to get it to even show up in GPART
Try the alternate install or minimal iso
c'mon now! if the default install won't see the drive, then the minimal or alt. wont see it with the complete driver list
